title: Unexplained Packet Loss To Oce Severs Only (nothing else)
body:
Hi,

I have been experiencing weird packet loss / high ping / lag when playing leauge of legends for the last few days, I have done tests and here are the results!

Ping test to oce server:
Pinging 203.174.139.185 with 32 bytes of data:
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=2927ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=58ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=50ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=788ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=1662ms TTL=53
Request timed out.
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=157ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=417ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=535ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=880ms TTL=53

Request timed out.
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=50ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=59ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=49ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=204ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=233ms TTL=53
Request timed out.
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=60ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=51ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=51ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=51ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=58ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=55ms TTL=53
Request timed out.
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=51ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=105ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=186ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=193ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=246ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=2657ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=102ms TTL=53
Reply from 203.174.139.185: bytes=32 time=55ms TTL=53

(Reduced to that many lines, the problem is consistent {{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} )

Anyone have any idea why this is happening?

Thanks,
Yoroshi

replies.body:
Hey there,

Could you do the following for me;

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the url to your ICSI netalyzr results.

Thank you for replying, (sorry for my lack of reply, was unaware of reply to this thread due to no email sent to me)

I could only do the winMTR results, as for some reason java was not working in any browser i tried accessing ICSI netalyzer with. results are below

Hey there,

Have you contacted your ISP about this issue?

Are you connecting via a wired or wireless connection? If wireless, could you try connecting wired and let me know if your issue persists.
